rules: Rule1: If the restaurant applies for a liquor license, then the restaurant obtains a liquor license
Rule2: If the restaurant completes the application, then the restaurant applies for a liquor license
Rule3: Either the restaurant receives a health violation or the restaurant is profitable
Rule4: If the restaurant fails health inspection, then the restaurant does not receive a health violation
Rule5: If the restaurant passes health inspection, then the restaurant does not receive a health violation
Rule6: Either the health inspector conducts an inspection or the manager schedules a reinspection
Rule7: If the manager schedules a reinspection, then the restaurant passes health inspection
Rule8: If the restaurant meets standards, then the restaurant reopens
Rule9: Either the restaurant meets standards or the restaurant fails standards

Rule10: If the restaurant fails standards, then, provided that the health inspector conducting an inspection does not result in the restaurant failing health inspection, the restaurant closes temporarily
Rule11: If the restaurant maintains cleanliness, then the restaurant is profitable
Rule12: Either the restaurant maintains cleanliness or the manager trains the staff
Rule13: If the staff follows procedures, then the manager training the staff results in the restaurant being profitable
Rule14: Either the staff follows procedures or the manager implements training
Rule15: If the restaurant maintains its rating, then the restaurant improves its rating
Rule16: If the restaurant increases revenue, then the restaurant attracts customers
Rule17: If the restaurant expands its clientele, then the restaurant increases revenue
Rule18: If the owner approves the menu, then the owner hires a manager
Rule19: If the restaurant faces bankruptcy, then the restaurant thrives financially
Rule20: If the restaurant experiences losses, then the restaurant does not thrive financially
Rule21: Either the restaurant experiences losses or the restaurant avoids losses
Rule22: If the restaurant avoids losses, then the restaurant does not thrive financially
Rule23: If the owner monitors performance, then the owner reviews reports
Rule24: If the owner analyzes data, then the owner studies trends
Rule25: If the owner studies trends, then the owner reviewing reports triggers the restaurant increasing revenue provided that the restaurant is not profitable
Rule26: If the owner approves the budget, then, if the restaurant is not profitable, the owner hires a head chef
Rule27: If the head chef develops a signature dish, then the owner approves the menu
Rule28: Either the head chef develops a signature dish or the manager develops a marketing plan
Rule29: If the manager implements the marketing plan, then the manager developing a marketing plan leads to the owner approving the budget
Rule30: If the health inspector conducting an inspection does not lead to the restaurant failing health inspection, then the restaurant does not close temporarily
Rule31: If the manager implementing training does not lead to the manager training the staff triggering the restaurant being profitable, then the restaurant maintains its rating

Rule32: If the manager implementing training does not result in the manager training the staff serving as sufficient condition for the restaurant being profitable, then the restaurant does not improve its rating
Rule33: If the restaurant not being profitable does not lead to the owner hiring a head chef, then the restaurant faces bankruptcy
Rule34: If the restaurant not being profitable does not cause the restaurant to expand its clientele, then the restaurant struggles financially
Rule35: If the restaurant not being profitable does not result in the restaurant expanding its clientele, then the restaurant does not struggle financially
Rule36: If the restaurant not being profitable does not cause the restaurant not to serve alcohol, then the restaurant completes the application
Rule37: If the restaurant not being profitable does not trigger the restaurant not serving alcohol, then the restaurant does not obtain a liquor license
Rule38: If the restaurant is not profitable, then the restaurant serves alcohol
Rule39: If the restaurant is not profitable, then the restaurant does not attract customers
facts: Fact3: The manager implements the marketing plan
Fact4: The owner does not hire a head chef
Fact5: The restaurant does not reopen
Fact6: The owner does not hire a manager
